sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Christianographie, or The description of the multitude and sundry sorts of Christians in the vvorld not subiect to the Pope VVith their vnitie, and hovv they agree with us in the principall points of difference betweene us and the Church of Rome. Pagitt, Ephraim, 1574 or 5-1647.
[24], 156, 56, [16] p., [4] folded plates : maps
Printed by T[homas] P[aine] and W[illiam] I[ones] for Matthew Costerden, stationer, London : 1635.
Dedication signed: Ephraim Pagitt. Printers' names from STC. "Of the antiquitie" (caption title) begins new pagination on 2A1. With a final errata leaf. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
Christianographie, or The description of the multitude and sundry sorts of Christians in the vvorld not subiect to the Pope VVith their vnitie, and hovv they agree with us in the principall points of difference betweene us and the Church of Rome. Pagitt, Ephraim, 1574 or 5-1647.
[24], 156, 56, [16] p., [4] folded plates : maps
Printed by T[homas] P[aine] and W[illiam] I[ones] for Matthew Costerden, stationer, London : 1635.
Dedication signed: Ephraim Pagitt. Printers' names from STC. "Of the antiquitie" (caption title) begins new pagination on 2A1. With a final errata leaf. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Matthew Costerden, stationer
T[homas] P[aine]
W[illiam] I[ones]
